intro: Peucedanum gabrielae, commonly known as Gabriel's angelica, is a rare and endangered species native to the high-altitude regions of the Alps. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and moist soils, often in mountainous environments. Its leaves are fern-like and have a strong, spicy scent, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Due to habitat loss and climate change, it is critically threatened and requires conservation efforts to survive.
